article:
backbone with numbers]] 'Flavones' ([[Latin|flavus]] = yellow), are a class of
 flavonoids based on the backbone of 2-phenylchromen-4-one (2-phenyl-1-benzopyran-4-
 one) shown on the right.

Natural flavones include Apigenin (4',5,7-trihydroxyflavone), Luteolin (3',4',5,7-
tetrahydroxyflavone) and Tangeritin (4',5,6,7,8-pentamethoxyflavone), chrysin(5,7-
OH), 6-hydroxyflavone, baicalein (5,6,7-trihydroxyflavone), scutellarein (5,6,7,4'-
tetrahydroxyflavone), wogonin (5,7 -OH, 8 -OCH 3). Synthetic flavones
are Diosmin and Flavoxate.
